credit_line: Museum purchase from Sarah Cooper-Hewitt, Pauline Cooper Noyes, and General Acquisitions Endowment Funds
dimensions: H x W: 221 x 1440.2 cm (7 ft. 3 in. x 47 ft. 3 in.)
title: Les Vues d'Italie (Views of Italy)
provenance: Was hung in the Tower House in Waterville, New York, in 1830. Moved to Munson-Williams-Proctor in the 1950s.
medium: Block-printed on joined sheets of handmade paper
description: Includes the Bay of Naples, an erupting Mount Vesuvius, tall ships in the harbor, and many figures attending to business and pleasure. 27 panels plus fragments of panels. Printed in a monochrome yellow ocher colorway, possibly called biche chamois.
name: Scenic
